etymologies: early 19th century. From scientific Latin Goodyera, genus name from the name of John Goodyer, English botanist + scientific Latin -a

definitions: Any of numerous small terrestrial orchids constituting the widespread genus Goodyera (also called rattlesnake plantain in North America); especially (more fully creeping goodyera) creeping lady's tresses, G. repens, of coniferous forests and bogs in both northern Europe and northern North America. Also (in form Goodyera): the genus itself.
